alert.note: Alert for Florence; Marion (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 8:15PM EST until January 09 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Cape Fear River At Elizabethtown affecting Bladen County. Great Pee Dee River At Pee Dee affecting Marion and Florence Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Cape Fear River At William O Huske Lock And Dam 3 affecting Bladen and Cumberland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Great Pee Dee River At Pee Dee. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood waters will affect swamplands and logging interests. Flood waters will affect timberland as far downstream as Yauhannah two weeks after the crest passes Pee Dee. Logging equipment needs to be moved. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 02/18/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Great Pee Dee River Pee Dee 19.0 18.9 Wed 7 pm EST 20.2 19.8 18.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=ilm The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 215 PM EST.
